messages.title: ONLY A MAJORITY GOVERNMENT CAN GET ON WITH THE COUNTRY'S PRIORITIES
messages.content: Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools. LET'S GET ON WITH OUR PRIORITIES.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: I'll oppose the plan made by the Mayor and Bury Council to build on green spaces, like Simister and Elton Reservoir. And make sure that any new homes work for us. That means our communities won't get swallowed up by Manchester.

Bringing empty shops back into use and investing in facilities that you can't get online, like better cultural facilities, restaurants, cafes and sports facilities. That way we can back local business on our high streets and regenerate our area.

I'll fight for our fair share of extra resources from the 20,000 more police being recruited. And I'll give them the tools they need to fight crime. Like more number plate recognition to tackle dangerous & uninsured drivers and better CCTV to keep our public spaces safe.
Government plans billions for hospital projects.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: END OF THE SOFT PRISON SENTENCE
ENGLISH SCHOOLS TO GET THREE-YEAR £14Bn FUNDING BOOST

mentions.tacticalSituation: At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority — or a hung parliament.

At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority — or a hung parliament.

I'll oppose the plan made by the Mayor and Bury Council to build on green spaces, like Simister and Elton Reservoir. And make sure that any new homes work for us. That means our communities won't get swallowed up by Manchester.

End of the soft prison sentence
English schools to get three-year £14Bn funding boost
With Corbyn propped up by parties like the Scottish Nationalists. And they're demanding ANOTHER referendum to break up Britain.
